article:
]] 'Wily' is a text editor created by Gary Capell for Unix computer systems. It
is based on Acme, the mouse-centric editing environment for the Plan 9
operating system.

Wily is one of the few editors that supports mouse chording. Unlike Acme, it
does not support mouse scrolls and its interface is black and white. Development
and usage of Wily has been deprecated in favour of the port of Acme to Unix
systems as part of Plan 9 from User Space.
